Reviews.Title: Very competent do-all camera
Reviews.Author: Analog
Reviews.Content: The HX10V is a solidly built and solidly performing camera. Is it perfect? No. As one reviewer remarks, the color accuracy is not entirely accurate. To my eye, over saturated and having difficulty with gradations of blue and red.  Reminds me a bit of Fuji Velvia. Color can be adjusted, though it is a minor hassle. I find the camera also has a bit of trouble with a yellow/green shift in indoor lighting-less than ideal white balance in tungsten and fluorescent light. Using flash or fill flash eliminates the issue. Flash exposure is decent in low light. Fill flash is very good in bright light. The camera's flash has quite a bit of punch for a P&S.; The camera has a bit more noise reduction than I prefer. In fact, the noise reduction reduces the effective sharpness of the lens. The lens on the 10V is quite impressive, especially when considering it is 16x. It is resistant to straight on flare, but tangential flare is an issue.  If only the lens had a provision for a lens hood... The distortion in the lens is well controlled. It isn't up to full on architectural work, but who would use a P&S; for architecture? All in all, an impressive and ambitious optic. The i modes of the 10V are the real deal. They slow down some of the responsiveness of the camera, but they deliver superior results in specialized situations. Personally, I love the background blur mode. Excellent pseudo-bokeh. The AF system is very speedy and tracks very well for a P&S.; Facial recognition is excellent. The camera's video modes are quite competent. I am not a video expert, but the image stabilization, sound, and resolution are excellent considering it is a P&S.; When looked at as a complete package, the 10V is well worth the price of admission.Addition 8/2012: After using the camera for a few months, I have found more quibbles: difficult getting a good sunset exposure, wishing there was more manual over rides, AVCHD eats up hard drive space on a Mac. On the plus side, I really have to praise the optics on the camera again. Great optic for the zoom range. The camera is quite fun to use and competent with a very high percentage of shooting conditions.

Reviews.Title: Read Manual! Great Motions Shots!
Reviews.Author: 10ant
Reviews.Content: Watched the C-net reviews and read the Amazon reviews and there was quite a few mentions of simplicity.  Simple for so many features?  Yes.  But for the average guy like me who never takes the time to read a manual and does things through trial and error.  I'd recommend spending a little time understanding the different functions.  It will make for a better experience with less errors.  Camera is great, took some difficult shot while moving.  I was amazed that the camera got the pics.  Took pictures from a moving seaplane and bobbing boat with hardly any blurred shots.  The camera works great. Panoramic function is awesome.  Haven't seen any of the issues with colors not being true as some people mention.I gave four stars mostly for the design.  The flash on the top pops up when you are holding the camera. Of course my finger is always over it.  The big screen on the back is nice, but if you drop the camera on the corner just right there is nothing that is going to protect it from cracking.  And lastly, although all Cyber-shots have the same dial, my finger struggles to hit the middle button just right.Other than that.  Great camera!UPDATE-12-5-12 Camera display stopped working.  The very concern I mentioned above regarding the screen cracking and being to close to corner has proven to be a worthy concern. Camera was in protective Caselogic case and never dropped. Screen just went blank.  Had to send it back to Sony for repair.  Waiting for repairs.  I'll keep you posted on costs.Conclusion 1-15-12  Camera back and fixed.  Sony didn't charge me for repair.  Took two weeks.  I had to pay for shipping to Sony.  Camera works great.  Only problem with repairs is a hair on the screen in the casing.  Drives me nuts but doesn't seem to effect camera.  Plus I don't want to be without it for another 2 weeks.  Just live with it.  Sony was very responsive.  Positive customer service experience.

Reviews.Title: Sony is picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: It's a Sony. The HX10 is a great point and shoot camera. It is impressive and feature packed. The specs are well documented. This  takes Great Pictures! You will love this camera.The 16x optical zoom can go to 32x with digital zoom. You get 18.2 megapixel sensor. High def 1080i videos look awesome. This is why you want this over a cell phone camera.The Ion Lithium battery can take 320 pics. Great battery life but I recommend a spare battery and charger available on Amazon. Note: The battery can also be charged in the camera with supplied cable.The camera is well built and solid made in Japan by Sony.This camera will make you forget about buying a DLSR.You won't go wrong purchasing this camera. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Brandi
Reviews.Content: I have had a steady shot before and I loved it! But this one is so much better!  It recognizes when I am taking a picture of an infant. Its playback options are so fun. The shutter speed is so fast! And no blurring.  I Love the option of taking video and it is great quality! I baught this to replac emy video camera and my old digital camera and I am so pleased! So easy to use! The zoom is amazing and so clear when used to take a picture! Its screen is a great size and I like that the button in the back turns like a wheel to scroll through pictures. You can turn the volume up and down and I like that it has a help guide on the camera so you dont always need your book to troubleshoot. I cant say enough nice things! Love sony and I love this camera I just cant stop playing with it!!!

Reviews.Title: SUPER impressed with this camera & I don't impress easily (UPDATE!)
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: NOTE: Right before my 30 days was up, the on/off button quit working, but I love this model so much I'm getting a replacement. Hopefully, just a fluke with the camera I had. Update: Received my replacement today, I decided to order a different color instead of the white like I had before. Apparently, it depends on which color you choose where the camera is made. The white camera I returned was made in China, the black and red cameras are made in Japan, not sure where the silver cameras are made.*****************************This is my second Sony camera, the first Sony I tried 2 years ago got LOUSY pet shots on the Pet scene setting, but was a good camera otherwise. I returned it since shooting pictures of my cats is the reason I purchased it Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Still Camera with Carl Zeiss Vario-Tessar 5x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080/60i Video (Black).Let me tell you - this HX10V runs rings around the WX9 (all these model numbers get confusing after awhile!). The camera feels solidly built. Several camera blog/review sites say it's metal, but it feels like plastic to me, although sometimes aluminum feels plastic-like so I will give them the benefit of the doubt. The tripod mount is metal, and the battery/SD card door feels a little flimsy like most do, just be careful with it and you should be OK.This is a KEEPER! On the Pet setting, it takes excellent photos and the default setting keeps the flash and also the focus assist button turned off - these usually will bother your pet's eyes if left on so this is an excellent decision on Sony's part...for instance: I'm a Panasonic camera lover usually and Panasonic's Pet setting leaves the default flash on auto and the red-lamp (focus assist) is also turned on and it's hard to get a photo where my cats' eyes aren't shut. Sony put some thought into the set-up here.And me being a Panasonic lover (in the not too distant past) I was never satisifed with the softness of a Panasonic camera photo.  I always had to tweek them in Picasa to sharpen them up a bit, as well as make the colors a little brighter.  Not with this Sony.  I have done no post-processing other than cropping.PROS:> Photos almost always turn out PERFECT!  Just the right amount of color and sharpness!> BEST VIDEO of any point & shoot camera, even expensive $600.00+ cameras I have tried! In fact, if you set the HD to the highest setting on this camera, it gives you a warning that if you are burning to a DVD, you need to make it Blu-Ray it's so good.> Solid build, although mine was made in China.  I think some are made in Japan, some China.> LCD screen is amazing, 921,000 dots, the reviews of the pictures looking at it on the camera almost look better than on your PC monitor.> Sony G Lens...an excellent lens used on their more expensive cameras.> Easy user-interface on the menus. I have only had to look at the manual once (looking for the macro setting).> Background Defocus...No need for a full manual camera to achieve the blurred backgrounds; this does a great job but you have to be around 30cm (approx. 12 inches) from subject for it to turn out well.> Battery life is excellent.> For those of you who don't want to fuss with a bunch of different settings, you can set this camera to EASY SHOOTING mode, it gives you all the "basics" to get great photos, but the wording on the LCD screen is in larger print, making it easier to read, and since you don't have many shooting options, very easy to take a photo and still have it turn out exceptional. The EASY SHOOTING mode is PERFECT for anyone new to digital cameras (there may still be a few!)CONS:> I don't like having to charge the battery inside the camera, but that is remedied by buying a separate battery charger.> LCD screen glare is a little iffy outdoors, I may pick up a matte screen protector to help.> 18 MegaPixels!  Really, this is a con - with a sensor this size, you don't need over 12 MP in a camera, more is not better in this case; but I will have to say, it doesn't seem to affect quality much on this camera.THE ZOOM: This camera has 16X optical, it will show on the screen when it starts becoming digital (digital is known for being horrible quality)...with either optical or digital, to look good you will need a tripod. The digital goes to 32X but photo quality will be poor with digital. (You can disable the digital zoom in the Tools Menu).GPS: Once you take your camera outdoors or near a door/window, that will trigger the GPS to initialize. Personally I don't care if I have GPS, whenever I upload a photo online, I don't want people to gather even MORE information about me, like my latitude/longitude coordinates. So I disabled this feature in the Tools Menu.RE: SUPERIOR AUTO VS. INTELLIGENT AUTO (on the Mode Dial). You have more settings to choose from on Superior, but I have noticed the camera processes more slowly between shots. On Intelligent Auto I get better results and the camera processes between shots seconds faster, almost instantly.SOFTWARE: There is no CD in the box; the software is stored inside the camera. Once you plug the camera into your PC for the first time, it will download and also get the latest updates off the web. PlayMemories is the name of the software and I like it almost as much as Photoshop Elements.For good quality video and fast camera processing I recommend a Class 10 SDHC card:Sony SF16NX/TQM 16GB SDHC Class 10 Memory CardIf you're looking for a well-made case and don't want to pay the high price for a Sony OEM case:Case Logic TBC-312 Pocket Video Camcorder Case with Storage (Black)Keep checking back, I'm in the process of uploading photos, but it takes awhile for Amazon to approve them.

Reviews.Title: Ermm..
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a day and a half now.Day one:-I find out that it does not have manual focus like the hx9v-I play around with the effects which aren't as impressive as my old canon.-I try out the zoom which is fantastic. I used it to read a page from a book across the house.-I try out the flash which is also fantastic. It somehow reaches all the way across two dark rooms to read yet another book page.-Pretty easy to use. I figured I'd get used to the controls quickly enough.Day two:-I go to try out the video feature and sound.-Playback sound isn't very loud but it's acceptable.-I go to move the videos on to my computer to hear them better... Camera not found on computer... Uh, what? I try another computer. Same problem. I go to trouble shooting and change a setting it suggests to change. It still doesn't work. I google the problem. No solutions. I try again and again and again. I plug the usb into the battery charger. It won't charge. Same error message that I get when connecting it to the computer. The camera says something like: Usb connecting... check connected device. Then it never connects. I charged it the day before and transfered pictures with no problem. So, why won't it work now? I then tried putting my memory card in another camera to get my movies but they didn't show up on that camera.So... here we are. Unless I find a solution I plan to return the camera... I may replace it with the same type or I may get the manual focus I was looking for. It's my fault for assuming the 10v and 9v were similar, but... it was still disappointing. Oh well.Major Pros:-Zoom (fadjfasijdfkg fantastic)-Flash (Surprisingly good)-Some cool features (Smile shutter, miniature effect, etc. Nothing too unique, though)-Clear pictures-Pretty good autofocus-Detailed picturesMajor Cons:-...Mine broke on the second day...-Not manual :/ this is a con depending on what you're looking for-Some pictures come out fuzzy-Some effects aren't the best. (For example, the HDR B&W; feature made everyone I took pictures of look like they were crazy senior citizens with with deformities. The soft skin feature was pretty creepy, as well.)-Pictures looked higher quality on the camera than they appeared when transfered over to computer.

Reviews.Title: 15 years of searching
Reviews.Author: Greg Dimas "CADman4life"
Reviews.Content: After buying 4 cameras in 15 years I finally found one that can take indoor shots. I'm not a pro photographer I just want a good point and shoot and this is it. My last three cameras, a Panasonic, a Cannon, and an Olympus, were all terrible at indoor photos, but this Sony is fantastic. I have been researching cameras for the past 6 months this time around. I considered Cannon, Olympus, Sony, and Panasonic. I wanted good low light capability, hi speed shots, and at least a 10x zoom. The DSC-HX10V has everything I need. The time to on is quick, and the high speed shots are excellent. I eliminated the Cannons, due to several sources stating slow focusing. A Panasonic in this same price range would be my 2nd choice but some pro websites say the photo quality is not as good as Sony. I did not see anything by Olympus that suited me. I can't speak to battery life since I've only owned the camera a week, but I purchased extra batteries and an external charger so I'm not very concerned. I took pictures at a friends baptism inside a church, (poor lighting conditions) but this camera took them in stride. For poor lighting conditions this camera will quickly take 2 photos at different exposures and combine them together, this takes a moment to process, but the results are excellent. Panorama mode is great as well.

Reviews.Title: Cyber-shot
Reviews.Author: trh
Reviews.Content: Like most Sony products it performs as advertised.  I'm still low on the learning curve, but have already gotten some excellent pictures.  I got the camera primarily for the Geotracking GPS features:  seems to lock fairly quickly, the indication of lock or "lack of" might be a little better.  For the zoom range it is a small cameria, easy to tote arround or drop in a pocket.  The small size makes the pop up flash problematic.  I prefer the flash on my wife's panasonic DMC pocket camers....

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Penny Allen "http://www.theallensisters.com"
Reviews.Content: Been playing with camera. Color options are fun to p,ay with (only reds, yellows, greens, etc) right from camera. Zoom is good. My favorite thing is it takes GREAT action shots. I got a pict of my daughter batting- you can see the ball right on the end of the bat, not crystal clear, but you can see its a round ball. The only thing I don't like is it has no micro for close ups of flowers etc. good camera overall. Glad I bought this one

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Chris Glacken
Reviews.Content: If you can still find these get one. I only paid 230 for mine. They normally go for 330 or more! Just google it it. I bought mine brand new. I won't lie though the camera only sucks when it comes to zoom. But if you see what I call "live caption video recording, its amazing, even through the view finder of the camera! For price and money its worth the money! I feel the seller I bought mine from be the person to buy from, they were fast and quick with shipping, I also suggest getting a  Sony Media 32 GB SDHC Flash Memory Card. This sin't the type of camera you buy cheap cards for. You know howmany pictures you can take with a memory stick like that? 5000+ HD Pictures, and about 2 hours worth of hd video. Not bad if you ask me!If you feel you want something in between a great camera and a good one this one be it, more towards great then towards good! So I say very good! What else are you going to get for 230 some dollars with a camera high end as this, you want more then this, well be expected to pay 400+ for one. >.< On sonys site this camera goes for 300 dollars "thats before taxes, and not counting shipping and handling" Good thing for Amazon to get it cheaper!Thats my review, I suggest acting fast in getting this before theres no more left to buy or before the price goes up!

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Book lover
Reviews.Content: I like the camera and its features. The main problem I have with it is the specialty battery pack. I used to have a camera using AAs, so there was never an issue getting more juice for it, no matter where I was. Now initially I wasn't all that worried about the battery being a specialized one because it was supposed to charge with a micro USB connection, and these days you can find almost always someone somewhere with a micro USB cable. What Sony does not tell you is, the battery only charges with the original Sony micro USB. No idea how they manage to do that, but my camera would not charge with any of my other 8 micro USB cables I have except for the original Sony one. A real bummer to me. You can download the pictures with any other cable, but not charge it. Whoever  thought this one up failed in my opinion. The pictures it takes are nice, but again, as some already mentioned, the flash is in a bad spot, my fingers are always covering it up and it is also overexposing the pics if you are fairly close to your target. All in all I guess I will keep mine, as I use it mostly outdoors and it works great for that. But I was expecting more from it.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera... just don't like pop up flash
Reviews.Author: L. B. Keller
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera (DSC-HX10V) and the Sony DSC-WX150.  I ran various home grown tests on both cameras under various conditions: action, with flash, without flash, zoom, natural light, etc.  Both cameras were set to the "automatic smart green setting".  The DSC-HX10V (this camera) photos were much more true to color in all photo testing.  Consistently the WX150 had a blueish hint to the photos - as in a vivid purple iris looked blue not purple like real life.  We have oak bookcases.  Comparing photos side by side with both cameras, the bookcases with the WX150 didn't have the golden undertones.  We called Sony about the blue issue and they said it must be a defective unit.  That may be the case.  I can only report on my experience.On the zoom test, I put both cameras to 10X optical and turned digital zoom off (note the HX10V has optical zoom to 16X).  I took pictures of the spines of my kids books from across the room.  The edges of the letters with the WX150 were "noisy" whereas the HX10V (this camera) at 10x optical were very clear (no, I did not pixel peep).  If you don't plan to do a lot of detailed zooming because you can be closer to your subject, this should be no big deal.  I take pictures of my kids swimming from the stands - I need a decent zoom without lugging a DSLR or hybrid.Both cameras performed about the same on action shots.  I had my kids jump on the bed for several minutes while my husband and I took photos with both cameras at the same time.  The HX10V does have a true sports mode which helped to reduce the blur some.  I still had to take a bunch to get the lucky action shots on both cameras.Note: all pictures were taken from the same distance, compared side by side, at the same size on the same monitor.  In other words this was as scientific as an average camera owner (not photographer) would do.  Ultimately we opted for the HX10V for the extra $60-$70.The only thing I liked better about the WX150 is the flash is built in whereas the HX10V's flash is a pop up and it is right where I want to hold the camera with the left hand (very annoying).  Though the HX10V flash is brighter and goes a farther distance.To compensate for the pop up flash, we get a nice "rubberized" and 3D hand/finger grip with a thumb grip on the back.  This definitely helps balance the camera better.  Though I recommend using the wrist strap to be safe - just as we do with the Wii remotes.The HX10V also has the 16X Optical zoom I mentioned, some fun features like toy, pop, etc, ability to adjust hue easily, a few extra smart modes and a little more control over settings like a M and P mode (not that I would use them but they are there).  Both have a full HD movie mode and can take 3D photos (though I couldn't test this as I don't have a 3D monitor).  I am sure there are other wonderful features but these are the ones I noticed.I hope this helps the average camera buyer.  You will see a similar review on the Sony Cybershot DSC-WX150.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera from 2011
Reviews.Author: linda rivas
Reviews.Content: This camera is in my opinion a combination of my 2 favorite cameras from SONY’S HX line. & they are the HX7V and the HX9V. I own the silver color HX10V. with this model Sony switches to a universal charge port a micro-usb. This is great camera it is well balanced spec wise. The #1 thing you should stay away from is a small sensor with lots of mega pixels, which just causes NOISE. To put it simply I put this 2011 camera against Sony’s own 2012 HX20V/HX30V & 2013 HX50V. and even took it against Panasonics 2013 Flagship Lumix ZS30. In most cases the hx10v performed better than all the cameras listed above. The white balance on this camera is great and low light video and photos are great too. On the video end the camera does 60i but honestly I owned other SONY cameras that could do 1080 @ 60p and I would always drop it to either 60i or even MP4 30p. I most cases when you decide to go for the latest and greatest you may not be getting the most for your dollar since you could be paying for features you wouldn’t even use. Nowadays camera makers even SONY are cramming more mega pixels in to small sensor point and shoot cameras. Everyone always has something to say about the RX100 and I have done my research and believe me it’s a HEAVENLY sent camera but the number one reason I didn’t and wont buy it is its LIMITED 3.6X zoom. I am a father of  5 girls ages 2, 5, 11, 13, 14 and all you want is a camera you can drop in your shirt pocket and go. The HX10V is that camera.Consider the silver color hx10v – the color itself make it look like its worth twice as much.. If you have any questions please email me, I have owned and used SONY electronics for over 20 years.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: JWink
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for an old Sony point and shoot that lasted forever until an unfortunate accident with the ocean.  (dont ask ;-)  This camera has lots of different settings and a good zoom with lots of modern features such as the antiblur among other things.  When I was comparing cameras, I also looked at the 2013 version of this camera the HX-30V and found them to be more or less the same, with the exception of maybe a little bit better version of zoom on the 30-V, however the 2013 version of this camera costs 70 to 100 dollars more than this one.  So if the 20 x zoom is worth the difference in price versus the 16x on this one, then go for the 30-v, but if not, then this is a good choice that takes good pictures and is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: Bring back the Joy of Photography
Reviews.Author: Jimmie D. Carter
Reviews.Content: After my Canon P&S; (years old) gave up the ghost, I spent a lot of time searching for the right replacement. Up to now I had always considered two features as essential in a P&S; camera, eye level viewfinder and AA batteries. After hours of review reading, spec comparisons for this and many other cameras, I kept coming back to this camera. So I changed my mind about the 'must haves' and purchased this Sony. What a great camera! Every aspect of this camera is a pleasant surprise. I have lost my desire for a SLR completely at this point. Pictures are ... picture perfect! Battery life is very good and the "Scenes" available are unequaled. My candid portraits get rave reviews from the subjects. Videos, video+stills, long telephoto, panoramic, bursts, and 'programs' that work. If this camera has any failings, I have yet to find any of them. After more than 60 years of Rollei, Nikon, Olympus and others, I have found a camera that goes where I go, and it has brought back the real "Joy of Photography" to me.

Reviews.Title: Product improves my picture-taking ability
Reviews.Author: Stan Huguenin "lover of rock + blues"
Reviews.Content: Though this camera has many features I will not use (3E, movies, etc.), its ability to provide me with sharp, color-rich photos is exceptional. I take many photos (too many) and do not want to be bothered with difficult technical details or instructions, and fortunately this camera's automatic default features make it very easy to ahieve outstanding results. I was very disappointed with the poorly written, poorly detailed brief instruction booklet that came with this unit, but went to the SONY Internet support site and got links to the printable information I need.

Reviews.Title: Sony Sybershot HX10V is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Hamed P
Reviews.Content: Amazing photo and video quality and the best one is recording and taking picture simultaneously! The only drawback of HX10V is the position of flash on the top-left corner, especially when you ask someone else to take picture for you, you should either ask him to expect the flash to be jumped up, or the other guy will be surprised and most probably saying "what the hell was that!"

Reviews.Title: Not so easy
Reviews.Author: Donald M. Schramm
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSCHX10v--was purchased to support field operations that requires GPS documentation with the pictures, as apart of litigation actions. The camera was purchased with that in mind. The quality of pictures is great,and the many features, but the Users Manual is basically worthless; the extensive internal menus and submenues in the camera are not user friendly and you must rely on discovery rather than guideance to find what you need. The software PlayMemoriesHome was difficult to get to download it did not just happen with a "click" as other brands of camera I'm used to. Once downloaded you discover it is not the latest version and you  need and must download the Expanded Version to get the edit functions you need. But now it will not download at all, just error messages. Sony Technical Support of little help--manual and user guide worthless except for the basic of basics. The learning curve is too expensive with this camera, I'm considering returning if I can not get to use the edit functions I need.It took phone calls to other users to figure out how to turn GPS ON, then you have to initialize all settings just to turn GPS Off. No explation in the manual. I need to have GPS data incorporated in the printed picture--so far unable to figure out how to do that. You should not need to create a Web Page Chat room to use this camera for basic function.  If not for quality of picture and optics, I would rate this camera a One Star.Don in Wyoming

Reviews.Title: very impressed
Reviews.Author: peterj
Reviews.Content: Still testing but have a few hundred shots and very impressed and happy with the product.  Would buy again.  Very vivid colors and good focusing.  steady at max zoom with clear shots.  excellent travel camera

Reviews.Title: Bricked after 2 weeks. GPS is poor.
Reviews.Author: Casper Chauncey
Reviews.Content: Well I've had this camera 2 weeks and when it works it is pretty good. But now the camera refuses to turn on whenever any SD card is inserted. Remove SD card, works fine. Insert any card, gets stuck powering on. Green light blinks very slowly. Must remove battery to regain control. Even tried a brand new SD card - same problem. No physical damage. Sony support said try a factory reset. Didn't help. Their warranty service is too complicated and slow, so I had to return the camera.Because of course it is pretty useless without an SD card.When it was working, I recorded a hike using the built in GPS log. You must remember to turn the log on at the beginning of your trip and turn it off when you are done. If you don't turn it off, the log doesn't get recorded to your SD card.I compared the Sony's track log with a track log from a "real" GPS. In short, the Sony was ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. The accuracy was horribly off. You can tell because when you walk up a trail and back down with a real GPS, both tracks are within a few feet of each other. But the Sony GPS return track was off by several hundred feet. Also, your position is logged only once every 15 seconds or so, not every second like a real GPS. Not that it would matter with this abysmal accuracy. Bear in mind that both GPS units were taken on the same hike at the same time so they should have been identically affected by any environment issues such as poor signal reception.The in-camera pano produces nice shots if you use a tripod. You must turn the camera slowly and steadily to the right. It takes a 180 degree pano -- you have no other choice. Also, you cannot use zoom during a pano. Nevertheless the result can look pretty good once you get the hang of shooting panos, which only takes a few tries.Battery life exceeded Sony's claims. I got almost 500 snapshots including a lot of zooming in and out, plus over 10 minutes of video, before the battery finally ran down. I didn't use much flash though.As others mention, the charging plug is weird. First, it won't take a standard USB mini cable. You have to use the included Sony cable, so don't lose it! Next, the cable plugs in to the BOTTOM of the camera which is awkward, and of course can't be used when you're on a tripod. Also, the camera will PLAY BACK pictures and video while connected to external power, but won't take photos. Why, Sony, why??I'd like to have hopes for this camera in the future. The locking up problem is most likely a firmware version 1.0 issue. If Sony doesn't release an update, though, this camera may be no better than a brick.

Reviews.Title: Needed more zoom for soccer action pictures
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Kennedy "Selectric 2"
Reviews.Content: Needed more zoom for soccer games--with this camera, I use it on forced flashevery shot---zoomed in  --then crop the shot in computer & the image is stillvery acceptable.  Wish the camera had come with a out-to-TV wire.  My previousSony wire is a slightly larger connectorCamera also makes a very acceptable video & can zoom in & out while recording.Very satisfied with this model --great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy Mills "cosmoclean"
Reviews.Content: This camera actually has many more features than I was even looking for. Very functional for almost any pic you would want to take for the novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: it was exactly what i expected!
Reviews.Author: victoria
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant camera for those who know how to use it! Don't buy it unless you know how to use a more sophisticated camera, this isn't your normal run of the mill point and shoot. It takes stunning photos and I just love it. For other camera jockeys out there, if your like me and you want to go straight for a DSLR but don't want to be fought in the "need more lenses" loop get this baby. Its not a DSLR but it has beautiful quality. Make sure you buy a good card for it though because it doesn't come with one!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Terry Zechman
Reviews.Content: I purchased the HX10V to replace my HX5V with 15000+ images on it.  Just past 700 photos and videos on the new HX10 and its picture quality is much sharper than on the HX5, however, the video quality isn't as good.Sony moved the HDR photo mode from the selection knob to the scene mode - since the scene mode defaults to your last selection, it hasn't been a nuisance.  I use this setting a lot on early morning, shadowy, mountain hikes.  Results are a little hit or miss, but if you want more than just a silhouette, it does bring out some detail.The HX10 has a new super special auto mode where the camera automatically selects the perfect scene mode for your shot.  At first I thought it was just another useless gadget, but I found it is surprisingly effective.  One caveat is that the camera takes extra time to process the image after the shutter is released, so don't use this setting if you are trying to quickly capture multiple shots.I do use the panoramic mode often and it is excellent.  The HX10 now has a high res option which results is a very large file size.  I prefer to shoot panoramics holding the camera in portrait orientation sweeping from left to right.  The HX10 does a great job holding the exposure through the continuous shot.I will say that the HX5 has been the most durable camera that I've owned in a long time and the HX10 appears to have great build quality as well.

Reviews.Title: Sony HX10V - not thrilled
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the HX10V but am having issues with the use of the flash. As mentioned in other reviews the flash pops-up which makes it more difficult to hold the camera as it is farily compact. The more troubling issue is the brightness of the flash. It is very intense and i have not found a way to adjust it. Faces are washed out and scenes look overexposed. I am considering returning the camera and finding somehting else.

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: SonicOrbStudios "SonicOrbStudios"
Reviews.Content: I got this for a family member.  Clear images, easy to use, decent price.  Sony really has some great point and shoot cameras and this is one of their fantastic choices.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rich
Reviews.Content: This Sony pocket point and shoot camera is small enough to fit into any pocket,but packs a tremendous amount of features and modes.  The quality of the imagesare outstanding, and it goes from wide angle to 16X optical zoom.  It can be usedfull automatically, either using Superior Auto or Intelligent Auto.  You can also selectfrom a multitude of scene modes.  Also note that it has a panoramic as well as a3D mode.  Check out any online review, but note that this camera is the same as aLeica that costs about 3X as much.  Incidentally, the ISO goes up to12,800, buttypically defaults to about 800 ISO in low light with the flash off.  Of course this willvary greatly depending upon lighting conditions.  The internal rechargeable battery is notcharged by removing the battery and placing it into a charger, but by inserting acable into the bottom of the camera.  Some people may find that inconvenient, butI have gotten used to that system.  So in summary, this very compact camera seemsto be very competent used fully automatically, but gives you many scene modes aswell as manual settings.  Unlike some older Sony cameras, it does also take regularSD cards.  Lots of camera at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: Sharp photos, good long distance lens
Reviews.Author: K. Gong "Over the Rainbow"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera a year ago and it's taken me a while to get use to it.My photos have almost always been sharp and the colors are deep and rich. I recommend this camera for its size (I can fit it into my side pocket) andsharp photos.  I still have to use the on-line directions sometimes, toomany features to remember.  Only con with the camera is that it doesn'thave a quick-easy manual and the flash is located in a bad spot (it'sright where I hold the camera).

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Granberry
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this camera for my wife, but she rarely used it, opting instead for her Iphone (which does quire well, considering it's a phone). I already own a Sony DSLR and half-a-dozen lenses, a Panasonic ZS8, and a Canon SX40HS, so I am not hurting for a camera to shoot with, and they all have their individual purposes. The HX10V has the Sony "G" lens, which is very sharp at all focal lengths, and is fairly quick to focus, even on moving subjects, although panning certainly helps. The zoom range (16X) is a very respectable 25-410 mm (in 35mm terms). Your video is 1080p, and 60FPS is selectable. The videos are very smooth at 60FPS, and the G lens is extremely sharp. The pictures are great, the video is outstanding. The panorama feature is nice, in that you can choose to sweep from left to right, or right to left, or down to up, or up to down. You can do 3D  pictures, and so much more to keep you busy. I am still discovering things I didn't know, but I like the camera very much. A great camera to take motorcycling, where room is limited. I could go on, but most of it would be technical stuff, and professional reviewers are so much better than me.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for my needs
Reviews.Author: mobile
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. It does much more than what I initially purchased for. Many people have seen me use it and ask how they can get one

Reviews.Title: Just awesome!
Reviews.Author: Jesse N.
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS CAMERA!  I had a different camera recently that I loved but i broke it so I searched for a new one and found this, it works well for a novis like melooking to take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Thsi is an excellent "everyday" camera.
Reviews.Author: Stuart D. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife. She loves it. The camera is small enough to carry most of the time. Yet, the zoom is powerful enough to provide the ability to shoot a wide variety of setting. This camera gives outstanding indoors low light shots. Although, we own more expensive cameras the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX10V is used much more extensively.

Reviews.Title: Great compact
Reviews.Author: William Greenblatt "Greenblatino"
Reviews.Content: This compact has full manual controls and takes great stills and movies. It's clearly designed for the more sophisticated photographer and would get 5 stars if it also offered raw files. But, it is still a fine camera for people wanting to expand their control beyond simple point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: terminatorf1000 "Fer"
Reviews.Content: simply the best camera you can get for the Price.... It came as advertised and the product Works perfect for my needs

Reviews.Title: Everything works perfectly-except...
Reviews.Author: Zilzal
Reviews.Content: Camera works as advertised, taking clear shots with lots of settings to choose from, and a great panorama sweep mode.  However, the small cover that closes the battery/memory card housing does not lock properly.  I have had to resort to pasting a small piece of electrical tape across it in order for it to not pop open during operation!  Since I was moving back overseas two days after receiving the camera, it wasn't worth it for me to contact the seller for a replacement...Oh well...

Reviews.Title: I recommend !
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. It does its basic and some more, has great resolution. I bought for my uncle and he loves it!

Reviews.Title: beautiful pics and right features for price
Reviews.Author: BRIAN P KENNEDY
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a camera that was inadvertently dropped into the surf.  I really loved my prior model, but this HX10V takes wonderful shots and has all of the features that I use for everyday photography.

Reviews.Title: Just arrived
Reviews.Author: VISIO "VELAN"
Reviews.Content: I'm having fun with this neat little camera! So far I'm loving the simplicity of it and the excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have only had this digital camera for about a week but I am BLOWN AWAY by all the great pictures I've taken so far. The image clarity and quality are AMAZING! There are so many options to choose from that I haven't gotten to them all yet. The one thing I like most about this camera is that even the recorded videos come out with crystal clarity. I am soo happy that I was able to read the previous reviews for this camera and find out first hand that those reviews were on point. This camera has not left my side since oopening the box and I have been able to capture so many great images for my personal albums. Now to find a printer good enough to print out my pictures with ask much great quality as the camera and I am set :'D

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: bodineeeee
Reviews.Content: Prior to purchasing this camera I had the Sony DSC-H70. I loved that camera. It was amazing so when someone broke into my house and it was stolen I was so upset. I had gotten a Nikon to replace it but it was terrible and I ended up returning it. Then I found this one and was ecstatic, plus it was on sale. Definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Overall
Reviews.Author: Sarah Warmbier
Reviews.Content: The video quality on the camera is fantastic. A lot of great features. Still learning how to use them all, but so far I am very pleased with it. Also the zoom is fantastic. The only downfall I have found with this camera is the placement of the flash and also the EXTREME power of it! It tends to wash some pics out because it is SO bright. Overall, good camera.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Champignon
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-shot produces incredibly sharp pictures and the "wide angle" has come in handy.  The product I ordered works well.  I took it to Napa and have a beautiful collection of pictures.  I also have taken pictures for real estate rentals as well.  The wide angle gives a better view of small rooms than a standard lens.  It's also easy to carry in a purse.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Really is a great camera! Have not had any problems at all. The menu is a little bit trickey to figure out, but the camera performance truly is wonderful. Great supplier and top quality product!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: RWH3354
Reviews.Content: So far I luv this camera!!! Picture quality is 10+++ & so is lens! The 1 shortcoming I've found so far is the flash is in a poor spot! Your finger will stop it from popping up sometime due to its location. I still would reccomend it as the best point & shoot digital I've ever owned!!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Michele D. Brandimarte "Happy`Go`Lucky"
Reviews.Content: The settings are so cool! It takes great pictures for a point and shoot camera and you can hand it to a stranger and they wouldn't have a problem taking a picture with it. There are already a lot of detailed reviews for it so there is not much I could add other than I this it is easy to use and once you test out all the settings you will be a wiz at getting the type of picture you want.

Reviews.Title: Camera replacement
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Held Jr. "Glass Man"
Reviews.Content: This camera is simple to use and takes better pictures then my older camera that cost 3 times as much. It also does 3 times as many things. At long range shots on vacation it cant be beat.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: L. Fisher "Books R Great"
Reviews.Content: I had a DSC-HX9V before this camera. I loved it. It took pictures of my kids, even when they were moving and took crisp and clear HD movies. My son broke the LCD screen while we were at my sister's wedding this summer. I bought the HX10V to replace it and have not been disappointed. I love being able to record my kids' special moments while taking pictures too. And the quality of the pictures is actually better than my other camera. It was a 16mp camera whereas this one is a 18mp camera. This camera has so many options that I havne't been able to explore yet, but I like all of my manual and learning curve items right there at the touch of my fingers on the camera. Over all a great product!!! Especially for being under $300! And I bought a square trade warranty to make sure it can be replaced if my kids decide to mess with it again:)

Reviews.Title: Perfect compact camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Kabli
Reviews.Content: Best picture quality and feature set of any non-SLR camera I've ever used. Highly recommended for travel and multi-purpose photography.

Reviews.Title: Excelente câmera portátil
Reviews.Author: Alexandre Baima N Almeida
Reviews.Content: Um produto bastante  útil (necessário), bom para as viagens que você nao quer carregar algo muito grande. Chegou dentro das especificações e no prazo. Podem comprar o produto.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot dsc-hx10v
Reviews.Author: Fausto
Reviews.Content: The product arrived really fast, and it is a very good camera. It has many functions such as scene mode: food, perfect skin, pet, etc. The movies made have awesome quality, such as the photos taken. the batteries last a lot, even when you're making movies or taking pictures with flash. I have absolutely nothing to complain about it.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT
Reviews.Author: mendoza carlos
Reviews.Content: perfecto tiempo de entrega, el estimado se realizo tal cual como se señalo en el momento de la compra, excelente

Reviews.Title: Love this machine!!
Reviews.Author: GaryBrazil
Reviews.Content: Small camera with many, many resources and great performance. Before buying, we had seen films from this camera taken in Europe by a friend and felt we were almost there. The camera really films great shots of any scene in which you find yourself and want to share with friends. So small and easy to use. Remarkable!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Prasad Thomas
Reviews.Content: beautiful photos. easy to to use. easy to carry around. easy to charge. beautiful shape. will recommend anybody to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Fun features with a great size
Reviews.Author: St. Bernard Mom
Reviews.Content: I have two DSLR's, but end up missing a lot of pictures because it is a pain to carry the big camera, multiple lenses and filters, and try to keep track of kids and dogs. Basically I bought this camera as a little camera to take not so spectacular pictures with. So far, it has proved me wrong.  The Good:  The camera is small and easy to carry. I cannot fit it in my coat pocket, but have been wearing it around my neck without pain or bother. It starts up very quickly (a very important feature for me). You hit the power and it is ready to take pictures.  It seems to have a good frame per second rate (FPS). It is not as good as my DSLR, but I would not expect that. You can "set" the FPS rate, but I have seen no difference between the slow and fast.  The special effects mode is really fun. One of my other cameras has this mode, but this Sony seems to be better. The options are: Painting, Rich Black and White, Mini,  Toy, Pop, Part (only one color shows up), Soft High key, Watercolor, and Illustration. You can take a normal picture and then apply different special effects. The best part is that it keeps your original picture so you don't ruin it.  The camera seems to have very accurate color. I have been impressed with the hues. I have not been out with it on a really sunny day, but on snowy days it is spot on.  The zoom is good. With a lot of cameras it feels like you can never get close enough. With this one you can.  If you have kids who don't like to have their picture taken, you can set the camera to smile mode and ask your kids which is faster, them or the camera. All you do is hold the camera aimed at the kid, and it takes a shot every time that they smile (great game and great pictures too).  The video seems to be great quality.The not so good:  This camera does not take micro shots. It does not have a Micro setting on Scene setting, and I cannot get it to focus close up.  If you accidently have it on Pet and try to take a picture of a kid, it always seems to be blurry, even though you cannot tell that from looking at the view finder.  The view finder really is hard to see in some outdoor light. You point shoot, and hope that when you get home you actually got something.  The buttons are too small to use with gloves. I cannot even get the thing turned on while wearing gloves, and I can fat finger it and push a lot of wrong buttons with them on.  Like everyone else has said, the flash is in a terrible place.  The manual is basically non existent. You must either go online for instructions or push the help button on the camera. The manual basically tell you how to turn it on, that is it.  All in all, I really like this camera more than I thought that I would. The Pixel size means that you can crop your shots and/or blow them up without problems. I bought mine at the local warehouse for two with an 8gb memory card and a small case included. As much fun as I am having with it, it is a keeper!!If it had Micro and a detailed manual it would get five stars.

Reviews.Title: Really great vacation shots
Reviews.Author: Amazon Prime Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a very fast camera, though the writing to the flash card seems a bit slow.  I did buy the premium memory card that supposedly writes 45GB/sec, but the camera does not seem to be able to keep up anywhere near that speed.Otherwise, the camera has outstanding features, and takes beautiful shots.  The GPS is an added bonus, though it did not always capture a strong enough signal to get a proper fix.I was disappointed at some of the manual settings, but then if that's what you're after, you really should be looking at SLRs, not these smaller units.All in all, highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Wasylewski
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother for her birthday a few months ago, and I have to say I've been really impressed! We have the picture quality turned all the way up, and it takes fantastic pictures. The sweep panorama is amazing. We've put the pictures on the flat screen and they're just as sharp. I love the noise reducing night mode. It's the first camera I've used that didn't take super blurry photos in night mode without a tripod. Don't fear though, it has a tripod night mode for you professional types. I took photos of the Los Angeles skyline from the observatory in the Hollywood Hills and they came out beautifully.I will say, if you are used to a really high tech camera, this might not do the job for you. It doesn't have a lot of manual adjustments. However, if you're used to mostly point and shoot cameras (like nearly everyone in my family), you will likely be happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: mamma
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a purse sized camera with excellent zoom, then this is terrrific camera.  We use it to take pics of our 3 small children- who are always on the move.  This camera always takes clear photos even when the subjects are not holding still.  The only drawback is that it takes about 8-10 seconds between shots, especially when using the flash.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: It does everything I need it to do.I take photos of my collection, of family moments, my pets, and every now and then photos when I travel. The video is STUNNING. It's not camcorder quality but it's great for the average user. Plus it's at least semi-customizable. I'm pretty knowledgeable about cameras and between the specs and performance the price is fantastic. I highly recommend this camera, the only thing I can't comment on is how well or long it holds up as I've only had it a week but I hope it lasts for years.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: CC Estimator
Reviews.Content: Was expecting a great camera but got a little better than OK. This all could be from the shipping because when I got the camera the box was open and there was a little rattle in the camera. Anyway I have returned and going to go back to Panasonic Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James Quattrocchi
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I have ever owned.  Takes great movies too.  I bought one for a friend, and I should have bought 2 because my husband prefers it to his DSLR and now I'm out a camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Hann
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVE this camera! My only issue is the optical zoom is not great, but if you are looking for a general purpose all around family type camera, you will not be disappointed in this one!

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Morales
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera last night and it is great. The pictures are crystal clear and it was shipped immediately after my purchase. Thank you, Hopefully it stays it great working order.

Reviews.Title: Supposed- over saturation
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R. Bissell
Reviews.Content: This camera does not oversaturate colors-it looks that way on the lcd screen because it has so many color dots on it. When I download the pictures into I Photo-the pictures are perfect on the computer screen. I think people are seeing the camera screen and judging the colors etc. from that . But the colors are perfect and very sharp when seen on the computer. I had a sony hx9v-and got this because I missed all the things this camera can do. Also have an NEX3 Sony and LX7 panasonic and several Canons. For a point and shoot this is very good! It beats the sx230 Canon for sharpness and color-and also has so many extras!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX10V 18.2mp 16x zoom
Reviews.Author: In to comfort and ease
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for an upcoming vacation. Love all the different and advanced ways to take a photo.  Have not used all features but anxious to try them.  I liked the open close feature where the battery/card go in my HX5 better. The camera is a little heavier than the HX5 but a great upgrade to that model.  Takes a little to get used to the battery popping up where you would hold camera, but flash is better than the older models.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all purpose camera
Reviews.Author: David in Florida "David in Florida"
Reviews.Content: I have used the previous models and find this equally easy to use or if you wish you can set the camera for more specific needs. The zoom is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Good Value Good Performance
Reviews.Author: Tigger64
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and takes great pictures when used by an amature like me.Battery life is good and all the features were very niceFor the function comes size and since I travel it does not fit into my pockets like a smaller camera I previously hadBut still a delight to use

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Anthony Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera. The pictures are very crisp and clear. There are a lot of features on it so I am happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: After Use Review
Reviews.Author: Rams
Reviews.Content: Sony as per the brand the quality and system use is good.It has the lots of features like background blur, one click HD Recording.Prons: Good picture quality. Easy to transfer. supports SD Cards.Cons: Flash, it pops up on the left top, it makes the discomfort for the user who clicks first time, they will hold it with both hands.connector, it is in the bottom, and always you need to keep your camera in sleep position while transferring to your laptop.

Reviews.Title: Best in it's Class
Reviews.Author: Dennis R. Parsons
Reviews.Content: Best in it's  class, video quality is superb also. Speed if awesome, would recomend using high speed chip 10. But I do that on all video and camera's I use. I relly like the auto macro's and the settings respond very fast as well. I have been a sony fan for some years and you will find some  feature about any camera you may need to work around but this camera was well thought out for convience sake. I have had this camera for about a month now and have ran it though the ropes day after day with pictures that come out SLR qaulity or very close. It's a mini marvel, really like where they put the users manual on the camera too, very handy even though I notice some do not like this feature. I would buy it again and again.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pics
Reviews.Author: Komal Kowlessar "Futurepower"
Reviews.Content: Still learning about this camera. I like it a lot and it does take very good pics. Very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected, worth it.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Orozco (Guatemala)
Reviews.Content: I'm an average person here in my country, so I can not pay to much for a camera, so i was looking for the best camera for my budget and I find this.It has a very good price for what it does. The pictures are amazing and the zoom surprise me... It has some amazing photo effects and a very good quality of video (Full HD), but when I record somenthing in 1080p (60i) and I see it in my PC I see some lines (like video out of phase) while the videos is moving, it is the only thing i dont like.. its not perfect but its very good video, the zoom and the focus works perfect.I have tried a Lumix.. but I dont like it.. because it was not what I needed...I recommend this camera to all the people... it has a good price and cover all the needs.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Review
Reviews.Content: Choose it for the 16x optical lens. It works very well in optical and digitial zoom. No problems in first 1500 pictures as long as I can steady the camera in extended digitial zoom. Movie mode and Panoramic mode both work very well. I have recommended the camera to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Singinstacy
Reviews.Content: A great little camera for the money!  I bought it to use for my Real Estate business, needing a camera with at least a 24mm lens for wide room shots and this is perfect.  It also does very well in dim lighting.

Reviews.Title: the greatest
Reviews.Author: Ron Cook "Ron"
Reviews.Content: This camera has it all . it does so much more than i ever expected from a small camera without all the extra lenses and gadgets that I'm amazed the pictures c9meoutn perfect no matter where or hown I take them . it's like magic

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera.
Reviews.Author: Nando
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Nice pictures and excellent videos. 100% satisfied with my purchase. Very good zoom, flash light and easy menu.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Taylor "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: So far I am loving this camera! I've been a fan of the CyberShots for quite some time now and this one does not disappoint. All of the available features can be overwhelming at first but after you get used to its capabilities and how to find and use the, you'll love the outcome.  One note -- if you attempt to use the iPad camera adapter to transfer photos from the camera to an iPad or iPhone, be sure to turn the USB power option "Off" in the menu settings before attempting to transfer otherwise the iPad/iPhone will give you an error message. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Chad A Dulac
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic first test run of this camera at Disneyland. Batter life was great despite repeated on/off/video and still usage. The panorama function was flawless, easy to use and made sterling images. The zoom is second to none and just when I thought I couldn't get close enough this camera was on top of it. Also standard imagery had a great wide angle when fully pulled back so it had a great range of views and perspectives. Pop up flash wasn't overly annoying and the camera was able to grab low light and bright light images in focus with no problems. Totally worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX10V Red.
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: It is a cool camera.  I liked it.  I had a Sony camera DSC-W150  before I bought this one.  I am very familiar with its features and photo information.  I bought the newer model with Sony camera and the pictures came out with better picture quality.  I am happy with it so far.  I just bought it last month.[[ASIN:B006K551TO Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX200V 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 30x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Red) (2012 Model)] from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very nice, loaded with features
Reviews.Author: Quicksilver gal
Reviews.Content: A learning curve required to master the ins and outs. Also the pop up flash makes it awkward to hold the camera to take photos

Reviews.Title: Big Camera small body
Reviews.Author: Mary Boyd-oliver
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for everyday and travel.  Fits in a pocket or purse.  Good lens and great optical zoom.  Lots of auto settings as well as some manual.  Good battery life so far.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Byron Maya
Reviews.Content: This camera to cover all my expectations, the functions are easy to handle and the result is fantastic.the shipping was fast and product arrived in excellent condition

Reviews.Title: Terrible stills in anything but bright light
Reviews.Author: C. Weaver "PsychoDoc"
Reviews.Content: The video quality on this camera is amazing, but it takes terrible stills in anything  but bright light. Even in a well-lit interior room, it slows the shutter speed so much that any amount of hand shake blurs the image (even with image stabilization on).  Another annoying issue that I hear is common of the brand is that the images displayed on the LCD screen have a yellow/green hue.  The actual pictures are fine, but it's just about impossible to tell how good of a shot you get color-wise from the LCD until you transfer it to a computer to see the image's actual color.  By comparison, my iPhone 4 takes far better pictures inside and accurately displays the image color.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: KP
Reviews.Content: I love, love, loved this camera. I say loved because I (so sadly) do not have it anymore because it was stolen. But the shots I took were great. Never got to see them on my computer because I only brought my tablet on vacation, not my laptop. If I had brought my laptop, I might still have my pics because I would have uploaded them to it. Anyway, I bought my camera at Costco before my trip to Costa Rica. Figured I'd upgrade my camera because the one I had was about 6 years old and pics are so much sharper, video better, etc. This camera even has a feature that you can take a video and take pics too. It is really a wonderful camera for a very reasonable price. I went on a tour of Lake Arenal and there was a family of White Faced Monkeys in a tree that you could barely see from the boat. I zoomed in and took picture, and they came out excellent. I also took pics and video of an iguana that was right outside a restaurant that we went to for lunch. So cool.....I had so many pics. But like I said, it was stolen from me. This was a couple of days before we left Costa Rica. I had my Nexus Tablet with me and on the way from Quepos to San Jose, we saw a group of Spider Monkeys that were in a tree. There was about 20 or so monkeys. They were swinging on the tree and then they crossed this rope that was stretched across from that tree to another on the other side of the road. Here are all these people in the shuttle we took taking pics and videos and I couldn't take any cause my camera was gone. So I opened up my tablet and kept trying to find the camera to take a picture. At least I'd have something, right????? No because even though the tablet advertises that it has a camera, there's no app on it. I found out later that you have to download the app from the app store. How stupid it that???? Anyway, needless to say, this camera takes great pics, of which I have none. I went back to Costco to see if I could get another one, but they don't carry it anymore. It looks like Sony came out with an upgraded one, so I'll have to look into that. I still have the AC adapter.

Reviews.Title: Love My cybershot!
Reviews.Author: Joanne Budzen
Reviews.Content: It has all the features I was looking for in a small camera. The quality of photos is exceptional and others are also impressed.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: sa
Reviews.Content: I like Sony but I just didn't like the feel or use of the camera. Sorry, not for me. I liked the dual shot option while in video mode.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Alonso Vargas
Reviews.Content: got it faster than i thought, right on time and works excellent, takes great pictures.Definitely was a good purchase

Reviews.Title: GOOD BUT NOT GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Rassushin
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera.  Now we wish wed done more research first.  The GPS feature is not great.  Our friend has a Panasonic that told us the STREET NAMES when we were in Europe.  This camera only gave us map coordinates.  The GSP feature also drains the battery very fast.  The panoramic feature is great and so are the display features.  But we think now we could have done better?

Reviews.Title: great pics
Reviews.Author: JVJVJVZZZ
Reviews.Content: the quality of every single picture is really good. you can tell when you see that when you notice that a simple picture requires about 5mgs of space

Reviews.Title: Buy it if you want everything yellow
Reviews.Author: Cheri Davis
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a pocket point and shoot. I have used DSLR cameras so I expect quite a bit from a camera. I had a fuji HS20 and loved the pictures that it took but the camera is too large for walks with my kiddos. I bought the Sony based on reviews. It did not live up to any expectation that I had for the camera. Blurry pics, yellow photos were all I could get. I tried to adjust its "white balance" to try to improve the warmth (yellowness) of the photos and it did very little to help. It is being returned to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Did not recieve a new camera as paid for-Got a Dud!
Reviews.Author: norcal customer
Reviews.Content: recieved the camera in an opened box- the view screen had had the protective cover removed and the screen had greasy fingerprints all over it.  Would have returned it right away if I hadn't been leaving for a trip the next day and needed a camera.  Warranty card/info was missing and as it turned out, after taking around 100 pictures with a new memory card that the internal memory wasn't functioning.  I got sold a shop model or previously (mis) used camera.  When I spoke with the company they were amazingly rude & said it was an Amazon issue.  Amazon kindly refunded me the money..  Camera has nice zoom feature & precise resolution, but 7ave or whatever they call themselves are not worth dealing with-will never order from them again

Reviews.Title: Lousy camera
Reviews.Author: crocodile bobbies
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand why the colors do not match the items shot, the video in low light is very dark. Our 5 year old Cannon A560 is a much better camera for accurate color, and low light video. It takes about 4 seconds for the view screen to show a scene, after turning on the camera. This camera is going back. We spent a month, reading cnet, amazon for customer reviews or any reviews before we bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: I would give this zero stars but the system won't take it!!
Reviews.Author: A. Greene
Reviews.Content: I HATE THIS CAMERA!! Sony changed to a HD dvd format that is imcompatable with EVERYTHING. Please don't buy if you actually want to watch or burn your dvd's to share with others!

ProductInfo.Features:
18.2 megapixels "Exmor R" CMOS sensor for superior low-light performance
16X optical zoom
3.0-inch LCD
Background Defocus highlights your subject like a DSLR
High speed AF improves focus speed
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX10V 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 16x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black) (2012 Model)
